responsibilities: Conduct in-depth data analysis to develop sophisticated work products including data dashboards, visualizations, and interactive graphics.
Perform data validation, data cleaning, and quality assurance checks in accordance with best practices.
Evaluate and optimize processes, identify improvements, and automation opportunities using tools such as Microsoft Power Automate.
Work closely with DYFJ units to support requests for analysis and produce internal and external reports.
Enhance and establish structures ensuring clean and accurate data, including reviewing current data processes and projects to make strategic recommendations.
Document methodologies, tools, and data collection procedures such as in Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) to document data modifications and definition changes.
Assist on other projects and tasks as assigned.
skills: Data analysis and development of data dashboards, visualizations, and interactive graphics.
Data validation, cleaning, and quality assurance.
Use of Microsoft Power Automate for identifying improvements and automation opportunities.
Ability to produce internal and external reports.
Strategic recommendation skills for data processes and projects.
Documentation of methodologies, tools, and data collection procedures.
qualifications: A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and two years of experience in community work or community-centered activities in an area related to the duties described.
High school graduation or equivalent and six years of experience in community work or community-centered activities in an area related to the duties described.
Education and/or experience equivalent to the above, with at least one year of experience as described.
